item.title: Serverless Patterns
item.description: Serverless Patterns Anyone with infrastructure architecture experience worth their salt will tell you that patterns are incredibly important. Patterns establish “how” you achieve a goal in computing, by explicitly showing you exactily how it’s been successfully achieved in the past. A pattern could be anything from a single module of code, to a complete reference architecture for a complex global system. The scale is not important, its the fact that you have a cookie cutter at your fingertips, that you can use again and again, rather than starting from scratch.
